Best practices for defining user attributes When setting up ABAC and dynamic groups in a lakehouse, carefully selected attributes are essential for reliable and scalable access control. Here are some recommended attributes:  Role or Job Title: Specifies the user’s role within the organization.  Department or Business Unit: Controls access by organizational divisions.  Project ID: Links users to specific project-based access requirements.  Location: Segments access by region or jurisdiction. Using standardized attribute names and values across systems helps ensure consistency and enables cross-functional access control.
